website_summaries.verdict: With two sizes available for different life stages, this menstrual cup is a winner with swimmers and women whose cervixes sit low.
pros: Form-fit rim makes cup easier to insert and remove without leaks
Can be worn for up to 12 hours
If you've been told your cervix sits low, you want this cup
cons: Weight of the cup can cause it to slip lower over the course of the day
Tip may be short for some to remove, so it's best for women with lower cervixes

customer_reviews.title: Less Firm than Competition = comfort!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried about 8 different brands of menstrual cups over the years and I seem to always come back to this one. The stem is a little shorter than I'd prefer for my high cervix placement, but the soft (referring to firmness of the silicone) is so comfortable and easy to wear and remove either way. Some menstrual cups have a tendency to put pressure on the bladder, giving the sensation of having to use the bathroom. But I LOVE that this one does not make me feel that pressure at all! And I of course can't forget to mention the outstanding price.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2 Boys

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it... gross
customer_reviews.text: It was comfortable and easy to use. That’s the positive but read on... Let me say I have used quite a few different brands for cups. I keep them for a while and use the intended washes to keep them sanitary and then eventually switch out. I personally like Diva cups the best so far. But this one.... omg it like absorbs the smell of your menstruation and no matter what smells horrific. Don’t buy. I only was on my second cycle and It smelled horrendous. I promise you I keep it clean and this isn’t my first rodeo with cups. I’ve used them for years. This one just is not the one ladies. Recommend diva cup all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Sansburn

customer_reviews.title: Do it. Switch to a cup.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time with a cup. I decided to give it a whirl while on an overnight hiking/camping trip with a bunch of teens. It was amazing to be able to put it in and forget about it. It did leak a little but I chalk that up to this being my first time with it. It held a lot, wiped out easily and allowed me to go hours without worrying about my period. There was a bit of adjustment period where I had to get used to putting it in and taking it out obviously, but it wasn't as bad as I thought. I should have gone with a cup ages ago.
customer_reviews.author: J. Korn

customer_reviews.title: I really like the product
customer_reviews.text: I really like the product, but I am not sure if it is really FDA approved or a cheap remake from China. I don't want to use material I'm not sure what it is... I could not find the product on the FDA site. I asked tge seller about the advertised FDA approval but never got a reply! There is no company or contact information on the package, so this is a bit dodgy... I really like the feel and use of the product, but will end up buying a more expensive brand one!
customer_reviews.author: Luise S.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs!!
customer_reviews.text: No. Just dont. Tried to save money, this cup is awful. Used other cups safely for years. First time using this cup I had horrible abdominal cramps and couldn't figure out why. Upon removing... omg THE SMELL!!! This cup, even after cleaned thoroughly smells like a combo of rotting tissue and petrochemicals. My cramps subsided almost immediately upon removal. I am shocked at how my body rejected this thing. It is not safe, dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: lindsay k

customer_reviews.title: Far superior to disposable products!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! Since using for the last several months I have thrown out maybe 3 or 4 pads from when I didn’t carry my cup to work with me at the start of my period. I got a second one this week to have a backup for my work drawer. It never has leaked and I don’t feel it when it is in. It took very little practice to fold and insert. The instructions were very helpful. This isn’t only a good thing for the environment but a far superior product to typical disposable menstrual products. So glad I bought one (actually, two).
customer_reviews.author: C. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Mothers beware!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second brand of period cup I have purchased. Even though the size I chose was for women my age & with children... this one leaked every single time. And it's not like I don't know how to insert a cup. I've been using them for almost 2 years. My first one from another brand got tossed away by accident. I saw this one was a little better priced, so I tried it out. I do like the color, because even with cleaning and boiling, the cup gets tinted. I tried using this one through 3 cycles, and I gave up and purchased the previous brand. It may work for women without children... maybe even with lighter periods.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Blakeney

customer_reviews.title: No going back
customer_reviews.text: I am now a menstrual cup convert! I knew I was set to start my period the day we left for our european vacation and I was so upset. I usually bleed through tampons within 30-45 minutes during my first couple days. I ordered this and thought it was worth a shot...IT WAS! Yes, I had to empty it every couple hours the first couple days but honestly I felt so much more confident AND i wore white shorts!!! I’d also been wanting to ditch tampons so this kind of forced me into it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as expected; gives me cramps
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use, I’m actually pretty disappointed with this cup. I have a heavier flow, and so I bought the bigger size, but I’m beginning to regret my purchase. The “pop” always sends pain literally shooting up my back, and I always get cramps when I have it in. 3 stars because at least it does what it’s supposed to do. I’m reconsidering whether to purchase the smaller cup, but I’d hate to have to go through the uncomfortable insertion process more times than I do now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Lena cup and LOVED it. But I found this one to be cheaper and thought I’d give it a try. It is REALLY soft so it takes a few minutes to expand once I insert it. The Lena cup is more sturdy (it reverts to its shape rather quickly). Not sure id buy another one of these. But over all it does it’s job and is REALLY soft/ comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Changed everything.
customer_reviews.text: Once you learn how it feels comfortable for your body; you’ll be happy with this. Especially if you’re switching from tampons. No more tampons soaking up every bit of moisture from your body causing irritation and rubbing your insides raw. Learn to get used to what feels okay for your body and don’t be afraid to use lube to make it easier upon insertion. And use a panty liner. Any discoloration/odor can be (mostly) removed by properly cleaning the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Try it more than once.
customer_reviews.text: I was very nervous since I tried something like this over 15yrs ago. Pre childbirth years. I decided to give it another try since we were going to the keys during the exact time of my crime scene days. I tend to go through at least 8 tampons a day and wasn’t sure how I was going to achieve this while on a fishing boat catching tuna This has been a game changer. Haven’t had any issues with accidents yet and the cramps are much lighter. After the first day I feel like I have the insertion and removal down.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey E.

customer_reviews.title: Too small?
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut the nub off the end of this cup because it was irritating my entrance when the cup slid down. I’ve never had a kid but I am sexually active so Im not sure if that has anything to do with my issues with this cup. It works fine and collects blood fine- it just seems to slip down after it gets somewhat full.
customer_reviews.author: MKS

customer_reviews.title: First Time Ever Using a Menstrual Cup
customer_reviews.text: I worried about the awkwardness of inserting something so bulky, but it was so much easier than I thought! This is my first menstrual cup ever and I'm so glad that I made the switch. I had the worries of how I would pull the cup out when the stub is so small compared to a tampon string, but it's possible! It's really easy to clean too. I got the size #1 for someone who is heavy, but I am the type who changes out my pads/tampons very regularly since I have a skin condition. So, I am looking into purchasing one more menstrual cup now to change out in between when I'm in the public.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I know what to expect when using a cup
customer_reviews.text: I've been a cup convert for 4 years now but was using the diva cup exclusively. I feel like I know what to expect when using a cup. Today's the first day testing the Athena and already I'm impressed. It's a much softer cup than the diva. I used my go to punch down fold and got it in and unfolded without much effort. Some days the diva cup takes a frustrating 2-3 tries because it won't pop open. I'm small, no kids, regular flow and use a size 1 in both cups. I'm excited to see how the day goes with the Athena, but I can already tell I've got a new favorite cup brand.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and discreet!
customer_reviews.text: I've been seeing people talk about these for years and I've always been curious so I finally ordered one. I've used it the last 3 days and so far I love it. Zero leaks, even st night. I'm getting used to removing it and reinserting it, which seems to be the tricky part. I've always found tampons to be uncomfortable and pads to be bulky, this is comfortable and discreet. I do however feel it could be problematic in public restrooms so I only remove it at home, but that's not an issue. So far I love it and would highly recommend it. Plus its going to save me a ton of money!
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Wise buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It takes some getting used to (inserting and removing). Once it’s in, you don’t even feel like anything is there. Save money!! I’m all about saving some money!! It’s a one time purchase instead of disposable products. Wise buy!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon and Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Beware of knockoff—typo on box!
customer_reviews.text: First time cup user here. When I was boiling it before first use, I reread the instructions and I noticed a typo on the box! Red flag!! I was like, ok the cup looks ok, so I still tried it for 1 day. Later in the day I started panic when I couldn’t get the thing out at first. Then ai remembered the typo! Likely a knockoff. If the company can’t even spell check, I am not going to trust this item especially if it’s supposed to go in my body! Wasted my money just to try to get a good price but am not going to put my health at risk.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C

customer_reviews.title: theirs no wonder that these things aren't talked about
customer_reviews.text: this is the thing that would end pads and tampons, Never again going back to them. So much more comfortable and worry free, and theirs no worry for nasty smells or feelings. i get mad that these products aren't talked about, they last so long and have so many benefits pads and tampons don't. I'd recommend this to even my worst enemy. Not to give them comfort in it but to end the nonsense of the overpriced menstrual product monopoly.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Skyrm

customer_reviews.title: Great strong, comfortable cup that doesn't stain!
customer_reviews.text: It seems I don't care for the stems because I barely used this stem. Therefore, I'm glad it's pretty short. I can imagine the uncomfortableness of a longer stem. I experienced few and very little leaks on my heavier days. I have a heavy flow, so I would need to empty sooner than 12 hours on heavier days. I try to empty only at home and when I do, I rinse and insert. I sterilize only after a full cycle. With that being said, I haven't experienced stains on my cup. It has stayed a nice blue hue. Also, it's strong enough that it stays inserted when bearing down without losing comfortability. I love this cup and will continue using.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I became an avid cup user a couple of years ago. This is not my first time using menstrual cup. However, I was extremely disappointed. It leaked even during my light day. Most important the day I was traveling it utterly failed. It was as if I was wearing nothing. I guess I should’ve stuck wever the DivaCup. At first I thought maybe I ordered the wrong sizevery it was user error, However after several cycles, I realize this Item was a waste of money. I’m going to go back to my DivaCup. I never leaked once, Ran a marathon with it and it stayed in place.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Lucero

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT - I ENDED UP IN THE ER
customer_reviews.text: I loved my cup at first, it worked so well and was comfortable and helped the environment! Until I ended my weekend in the emergency room because it got twisted very far inside of me and I couldn't remove it. The tab to remove it is TINY and it literally got STUCK INSIDE OF ME AND HAD TO BE REMOVED BY A DOCTOR. NOT FUN. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I couldn't even return it to get a refund because I was so disgusted I wanted it out of my sight forever.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Leak free - stress free
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using the Athena cup. It will take some time to get better at inserting the cup and making sure it is open. I found it easier to do the push fold down method. Once, it was in place, it has been the best 24 hours. I have not had any leaking, it's very comfortable to use and I will not go back to using the disposable softcups. I only had to change it once, at the 12 hour mark. I probably could have gone longer since, it was only half full. The mess was minimal compared to using the disposable softcups. I'm so happy that I tried this product. ☺️
customer_reviews.author: Bev.

customer_reviews.title: YouTube videos and water based lube
customer_reviews.text: Listen, I am a nervous nelly and am SICK of ruining undies just because I am incompetent when it come to being a woman. This cup, with a little bit of practice and YouTube videos, is amazing. An entire work day with no leaks or spills on my first try!! You just have to be patient and listen to your body. I put it in and took it out a couple times before I knew it was right! I also watched a video made by diva cup and they said it’s okay to use water based lube and that helped me SO MUCH! Time to save the planet ladies and gents
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: You're questioning buying but just do it!
customer_reviews.text: I cant even imagine using anything else now. I used to question like you but seriously this is the best way to go. You can go 12 hours with this cup in. That's right. A whole work shift without having to interrupt 3-5 times to change whatever because of your heavy flow. I cant believe more women dont know how great this is. I've been trying to spread the word because it's so easy and so much better and easier for women. Just fold and place then hours later pull out and rinse. And I love the black color because it doesn't show the blood as much
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, go for it!
customer_reviews.text: Very soft, opens easily, is comfortable, easy to put. I’ve had more success with this one then with a Brazilian brand I had been using (Fleurity). The bottom stick doesn’t bother me like it did on the other cup (I had to cut the previous one). The little cloth bag that comes with it is really cute. I’m buying another one to gift my best friend.
customer_reviews.author: mariana holanda

customer_reviews.title: Pick the CORRECT size
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product, but I definitely got the wrong size. My flow is somewhat heavy, however I’ve never had children. I purchased the smaller size and it worked GREAT the first day(usually a lighter flow) and on the second day (heavier flow) it overflowed every two 2-3 hours. I enjoyed the product on day one so, Im assuming I just got the wrong size. Easy fix, I’ll be ordering the bigger size. Only complaint is the cute decorative bag with leaves lint particles on the cup. It’s also an easy fix with a quick rinse.
customer_reviews.author: jsonp9

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, and cups mean no bad smell!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about making the switch to cups at first. I did a lot of research and finally gave it a shot. I now will never go back to traditional pads/tampons/liners. I work full time and am a full time college student. I love that they can be left in for 10 or so hours. Gives me the freedom to live my life. No leak, no smell, and as long as you insert correctly, you don't even feel it.
customer_reviews.author: Corbach Toolis

customer_reviews.title: Leak free and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time using a menstrual cup. I used a Diva Cup before and misplaced it, so I bought the Athena cup and it works just the same with the same quality. I feel like this one is sometimes harder to get in and I'm not sure why. I didn't have much trouble with the Diva cup. I don't know if the Diva cup was more flexible and soft. It is leak proof and once it's in, it's not noticeable. I also love that it comes with a bag! Super helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great but hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: I chose the medium size because I am a bigger girl, with a heavy periods. I have never had children before. I now know that medium was way too big. If you are unsure of what size you are, go with a smaller one. Once it sits in place it is comfortable. The suction power is super strong. It was difficult to remove. I wish the design of the nub was easier to grip.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Issues
customer_reviews.text: I got the smaller size cup and it worked well in the beginning, but I noticed small leaks even though I knew the suction was correct and it was placed correctly. The small leaks didn't deter me though. However, just this past week I have had huge unexplained leaks usually when I'm in bed, switching position in my sleep or after exercising. I check the cup after these accidents and it seems in place, but it's frustrating. So although this cup is good for its purpose of containing the blood, I am giving it two stars because the suction obviously doesn't work properly when one second I'm fine and the next I'm rushing to the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to tampons
customer_reviews.text: I will never go back to tampons again! The best $15 well spent. I work at a Veterinary hospital, so trying to take a bathroom break is very limited. With this cup it was one less worry on my mind. For me, inserting it was easy. BUT taking it out is slightly uncomfortable. The suction is so secured it is a bit of a challenge to take it out. But it does gives me a peace in mind that it is not leaking. Still iam very happy with thee results and will buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: lucia

customer_reviews.title: Never Buy Tampons Again
customer_reviews.text: Menstrual cups can be tricky but once you learn how to use them, they are wonderful. This is one of the nicer ones I have seen, and I really love the cute pouch. Another plus is that the little handle nub is not too long, so it doesn't protrude and become bothersome like the last one I was using. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to be environmentally conscious and/or save a lot of money. It pays for itself in the first month and then you never have to buy tampons again!
customer_reviews.author: Leila

customer_reviews.title: Falls short for me compared to the Diva Cup
customer_reviews.text: After having used the Diva Cup and then trying out this product... I was disappointed in how the Athena Cup worked for me. The silicone was less malleable than the Diva cup, this inserting this cup was a nightmare. It did not want to stay in the U shape that you squished it into (pushing in the middle, and pinching in the two sides) and so I had a lot of issues. I used this for ~4 months and I ended up going back to the Diva Cup.. 3 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M

customer_reviews.title: I was a little apprehensive at first because the price is half the diva BUT I like this one better
customer_reviews.text: Have you used a diva cup? I was a little apprehensive at first because the price is half the diva BUT I like this one better. I have been a cup user for 3 years. The diva cup was the only brand I ever bought. I like this one for a few reasons...1. It is lighter, diva is a heavy silicone 2. You can get colors..ahhheemm when you use a cup for a couple months...clear is not good. I bought dark grey, no discoloring so far. 3. The price can't be beat. Even if I had to replace this one a little sooner the value is waaaaaay better
customer_reviews.author: JenniferL

customer_reviews.title: Better than Divacup
customer_reviews.text: I had a Divacup for a while, but I'd always have to wear backup pads because it always leaked. When it got old, I ordered this one. I ordered a size 2 because I have a heavy flow and I'm very active, yet I've never had kids... but this one does not leak as the Divacup did. It feels softer and I like that it comes in different colors, because I'm cool like that. Also, it's cheaper so YAH! I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Keah

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for?
customer_reviews.text: Took me a little while to get the hang of this thing, but once I did, I can't believe I didn't get one sooner. This is the only menstrual cup I have tried, but I don't know if it could get any better. I got the black one, and love the little bag it came with. The price of this particular cup is better than others I've seen as well. I even gave one as a gift because I love it so much!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy, disappointingly thin silicone. -Veteran cup user. Cups should not be expensive to get quality and retailers like this-- box riddled with typos as well--don't help promote cups, which help save the environment and are better for women. Will have to buy a thicker one a la Diva Cup (which needs to get cheaper).
customer_reviews.author: urbantiger

customer_reviews.title: The most important purchase I've ever made!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my Athena Cup for nearly a full year now, and I honestly regret not purchasing it sooner! Using a menstrual cup is a bit tricky at first, and you do have to get really familiar with your body to fully get the hang of it, but I've genuinely recommend using a cup to every female I know. Even on the heaviest days, 12 hours of wearing the cup without emptying it, it still doesn't leak. It's such a great investment, I'll never have to touch pads or tampons again (and I never want to)! I 100% reccomend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Liz J.

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go with the size 1 even though by all suggestions I should have picked the larger size. The size 1 fits better with my low cervix, I had no issues with putting it in, nor removing it. I used it for the first time this past week while on vacation and it was wonderful, I had no leaking and it was so much more convenient than using a tampon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the concept behind these
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the concept behind these. Unfortunately the one I purchased did not prevent leakage. I was careful to properly install & use it & without it filling all the way (not even halfway) it did not stop my clothes from getting stained.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa

customer_reviews.title: and they have all been excellent products, but this one comes in with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been an exclusive cup user for the past 4 years and have gotten 6 friends to switch from conventional products to cups as well! I have used The Diva, Eva and now the Athena, and they have all been excellent products, but this one comes in with a much lower price tag. Quality feels great, and I appreciate the black, more opaque color, I am hopeful that over time, it will stain less. It came with a great little manual I dont remember seeing in other brands. I have already recommended this brand to friends!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This product was a gift as a first cup to my sister in law. She wasn’t sure she’d like it so I wasn’t going to spend a bunch of money. I compared this Brands softness to that of my lily cup online on a softness chart, and thought it would be perfect for her. She told me it was easy to insert and open and has worked super well. She loves it and loves the color choices. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Elise

customer_reviews.title: Got stuck.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I experienced the horror situation of the cup becoming stuck and having to go to urgent care to be professionally removed. It was the first time I'd used the cup while on my period, before I'd practiced twice with no issues. This time, no bueno. I wish that this had worked for me because I was so excited to be able to reduce the amount of waste I contribute to landfill. I hope it works for you!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not a good period product
customer_reviews.text: this is possibly the worst period product i have ever used it literally took me 20 min trying to get this to go into place where it is suppose to be staying closed and not opening fully and this is with the smaller size also you must soak this product for 10 to 20 days because the rubber itself holds all smells and being a woman you know exactly what i mean
customer_reviews.author: Dragon Queen

customer_reviews.title: Just try it!
customer_reviews.text: Trying one of these was right up there on the Nope List with online dating for me. Life changing. This is going to save me so much money on my typical hygiene product spending. Don’t take my word for this, but I think my period actually was less painful and lasted fewer days! I’d advise some reusable liners for lightest days, but this worked great on its own. Oh and FYI, I’m still keeping online dating at the top of the Nope List.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: I really like how this is better than just using a tampon ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like how this is better than just using a tampon or pads. I really hate having to wear pads because you're basically sitting in your blood all day which is a sickening feeling to me. The only thing that I don't like about the menstrual cup is that usually within the first days of being on my period, it tends to leak, but when I empty it, it wasn't even full. The other thing I don't like about it is that it stains really easily....which makes it look super gross, even if you wash it.
customer_reviews.author: Joya Yager

customer_reviews.title: Soft, flexible, comfy!
customer_reviews.text: A great find! I previously used the small lena cup for comparison. This athena one is slightly more flexible and so feels more comfortable. I like this one better for lighter days, but am wary to try for heavy days because of the flexibility. It might take some time for me to completely trust it but overall a great option for comfort!!
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Officially converted. Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am officially converted. I was so nervous trying this because I've always used tampons and some reviews said it took a couple of tries to get it right but right off the bat I loved this. As long as you insert it the way the videos show and rotate it 360 when inside you'll have no issue! I am a mother of 1 and relatively small, and I haven't had intercourse in the 7 months since my daughter was born so I almost got a size 1 but the 2 fits great. I can barely feel it and no leaks. Going to try and convert all of my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am new to menstrual cup. So initially as I was learning to use it, it was a little bit of a struggle. But once I got the hang of it, I am loving it. Also, I feel good that I was not causing any more environmental wastage by using sanitary pads. Really convenient to use and love the little pouch it comes in.
customer_reviews.author: LHD

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: My first time using the cup and I went with Athena, the manual that comes with the cup is really informative and through, the cup itself was really comfortable to wear and I’m really happy I made the choice to try it out as I actually didn’t feel as uncomfortable as I normally feel on my period... it went by so quick! Great option if you’re starting and dont want to go for other more expensive brands without finding out if it will work for you(:
customer_reviews.author: Alix

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and never leaks, just try it
customer_reviews.text: I was scared/ apprehensive to use this after using tampons for 15 years. This is way cleaner and an easier solution. It took a few “tries” to get the right position, but once you get used to it you can’t feel at all. It had never leaked for me and I empty it about every 12 hours and consider my periods heavy. Give it a try! Cheaper than tampons too! Wish i would have made the switch sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Howe

customer_reviews.title: Stem too long for size one.
customer_reviews.text: I like how it comes in my favorite color - green; and it has a cute, feminine carry/storage bag. It holds a lot of fluid - enough for at least 10 hours. It’s very easy to insert and remove. I don’t like the stem length. It sticks out and makes using the restroom difficult. I’ve trimmed it as low as I can take it without cutting into the cup and now it’s perfect! This is my second favorite cup. I normally use the meluna shorty because of its size but this one is more cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, you forget you're wearing it!
customer_reviews.text: The color of this cup is so beautiful. I know, like who's gonna see it, but still I like it. I already own different brand of menstrual cups but I wanted to give these a try for the variety of colors and to replace one that's already stained. It's very comfortable can't even tell I'm wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not my favorite menstrual cup
customer_reviews.text: The Athena cup works, but the cup itself is very flexible and a little more difficult to insert than the Diva Cup. It was hard to get it to pop open and because of it's flexibility, it would bend and fold when trying to insert it. Once it was in, it was fine. I was paranoid while wearing it because I thought it would fold or bend with any movement. I use it as a backup to keep in my office if my period decides to make an unscheduled visit, but I prefer the rigidity of the Diva Cup.
customer_reviews.author: Neiky

customer_reviews.title: didnt fit?
customer_reviews.text: I got the smallest one you have even tho i have a had a child. The diva cup was so uncomfortable and it put pressure on my bladder it felt like. This one I couldnt even get to open inside. I jammed it up there and twisted and never got it to pop open, there is only so many ways you can put the thing in, so after a few attempts, i gave up. Disappointed with the design I guess.
customer_reviews.author: manderz

customer_reviews.title: Great product, no leaks, a bit on the large side for insertion
customer_reviews.text: Once inserted this product is super comfortable and leak free. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I found the insertion uncomfortable. I think it’s too wide. I’ve used the flex disc and that insertion is more comfortable than this, but it leaks a little and I found my period dragging an extra 1-2 days with that product. I bought the regular one not the larger one and I highly recommend you start with that one. A caveat is that I have not had children so perhaps that’s why I found the insertion uncomfortable. Once in place though everything is great.
customer_reviews.author: Underground Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: It worked great. I had no leakage and once it was ...
customer_reviews.text: So I decided to try this product out. This was my first time trying out a cup and I have to say it just wasn't for me. It worked great. I had no leakage and once it was inserted I couldn't feel it. I just found it hard to insert and removed. I also don't like having to empty and rinse the cup as the sink is not always nearby and it makes it difficult. I would recommend it to someone who likes a cup over other sanitary product though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this cup for one period but it is amazing! I was having allergic reactions to tanpons so I switched to this menstrual cup after reading reviews and I'm SO glad I did! It's not very messy when you remove it, and it's pretty easy to insert and remove as well. Great product, I'll want to get a second one soon!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Wells

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product and not so scary
customer_reviews.text: I can't even describe how much I love my Athena Cups. They are freaking amazing! I was aprehencive to try a menstrual cup be decided to give it a try. I've had it for 3 cycles now and haven't used a pad or tampon since I started using these. I love my first 1 so much I purchased a second 1 as back up. Note: It is frustrating at first learning the best way to insert for you, but if you stick with it you will be so glad you did. I won't buy any other brand than Athena.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. Compared to the diva cup it is less stiff/weaker. That means that it takes more effort to get it unfolded and into shape after insertion. It also does not have little ridges around the grabbing point like the diva cup has. It is more difficult to grab/pull out but not too difficult. I liked the Athena Cup a lot until I put it beside my suitcase where the dog could reach it. A quick trip to Walmart and now I have a more expensive Diva Cup.
customer_reviews.author: AnndeLion

customer_reviews.title: Gane changer
customer_reviews.text: I was definitely extremely skeptical about this product, but this is a tot gane changer for real. I am recommending this to all my girl friends, even though I'm getting crazy looks when I do so. Took me a day to get accustomed to the proper angle, but once I did I slept in it and everything. It's almost like you're not even on your period at all and it wasnt gross or messy when taking it out. Major win and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Aura

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, I wish I would have switched years ago.
customer_reviews.text: This cup is amazing. This was my first time using a cup and I won't go back to those cotton plugs. It is easy to use and is more comfortable than I had thought it would be. I have suffered with super heavy flow for years, so bad that I've missed work because I couldn't leave the house. On my heaviest days I used to change my tampon almost hourly but with this cup I was able to go 3 to 4 hours between changes. On normal flow days I could go up to 6 hours. I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa James

customer_reviews.title: Awessssoooomee
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had both the diva and this cup, honestly both were great. I like this one better because of the color, the price, and the bag. I chose size one and I kept going back and forth thinking “well yes I’m 27 and have no kid but...) size 1 works great and I’ve never leaked. Get this; ppl get scared by it for some reason. NO reason to; I find femine odor decreased dramatically (as did waste biproduct)
customer_reviews.author: YourFriendlyNeighboorhoodRDH

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2016 July. It is 2018 October and the tip that you use to pull it out broke off. I don't even use it every day of my period because my first day or two is so heavy that this thing can't keep up with it. So basically I used it about 3 days per month and it's a goner. Otherwise, I like it, saves money and kinder to the environment than tons of tampons and pads.
customer_reviews.author: Ildiko Markovsky

customer_reviews.title: Easy and it works!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than tampons. Was not very hard for me to figure out on first try and I do not have problems with it leaking. It does cause some cramping but I also get cramps with tampons on occasion. Nothing a little Midol and Tylenol won't take care of. I got this because I have a wedding coming up next month (during my menstruation cycle) and I do not want to have to change tampons in a wedding dress. Now I can feel confident on my special day.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Save the earth, use Athena.
customer_reviews.text: Listen. I was skeptical and swore I would never use one of these puppies for years but I'm glad I gave it a whirl. It is very nice to not have to change it every few hours and you really can't feel it at all. No leaks, easy to clean, fits great. It took me a few days to get used to it so hang in there if you are riding the struggle bus like I was. You'll get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Easier than I thought!
customer_reviews.text: My doctor told me about menstrual cups at my yearly appointment. I had heard of them but was scared to try. To my delight, my cup was easy to insert. I love the freedom of not having the yucky diaper type feel during my period. Also, being able to track how much blood I am losing has been helpful since my flow is heavy. I will say that the cup can overflow overnight since my flow is ridiculously heavy (I have a large uterine fibroid), but the cup is way better than having to use tampons and heavy pads and having to switch those all the time. I definitely will never go back- I truly love this crazy new gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H.

customer_reviews.title: Could be better but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The C fold is just not the way to go. I got the larger because my flow is heavy every cycle. The silicone is smooth but the rim is pretty hard. I can't get it to pop open, even after turning it multiple times and feeling to see if it was open, no. The stem length is ok. I didn't have trouble getting it out. A little disappointed but what can you expect with a cheaper price and a not well known product.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Soft cup!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cup! I’ve had it for over a year. While it’s a little trickier than another brand to get to pop open, it is way more comfortable! Love how soft it is. And I’ve figured out the trick for my body, which is reaching my finger up to the edge of the cup once it’s in and turning it in a circle all the way around. Never leaks now.
customer_reviews.author: Jenelle

customer_reviews.title: Does as discribed
customer_reviews.text: It does its job exactly as discribed in description. Though size is uncomfortable for me. I got the larger size being a larger woman and heavier flow. I can't wear it for long periods at a time but good to have if you get in a pinch and are out of supplies. I should have ordered a small one. But I'd definitely recommend someone having it.
customer_reviews.author: Wes and Tara Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I switched from the Diva cup to this one and LOVE IT!! This is slightly more flexible and stays in place, unlike my diva cup which kept sliding down through the day. The stem is smaller and so comfortable. The price is much more affordable and I cannot recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and doesn't leak
customer_reviews.text: I used a different brand for 4 years before I had my second baby, and I just assumed they all leaked because I had major leak issues with the old one. After baby#2, I bought the Athena cup, and what a difference! No leaks and no getting stabbed by a long stem. It's SO comfortable! I suppose it might be a little more difficult to remove, but it's a learning curve and worth hanging in there to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Auntie

customer_reviews.title: Good for regular periods
customer_reviews.text: My first test run with this was great, it was super convenient not having to worry about what time it was. However after having it for a month I can say that if you have an extremely heavy flow this will not work, within two hours I have to change it. I definitely love how environmentally friendly it is and it does a really great job at absorbing smell. The bag it comes in is super cute and was high quality. I purchased the clear one so that upon cleaning I could ensure it was fully cleaned and staining was a concern of mine but it looks the same as the day it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Ward

customer_reviews.title: My second favorite cup
customer_reviews.text: I really do like the Athena cup. It is a great starter cup for someone new to using menstrual cups. It is not as comfortable for me because of where my cervix sits, but women with a higher cervix would probably find them very comfortable. No leaks, easy removal, durable construction.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love the Athena cup. The first couple uses definitely took a few tries to get used to inserting, but once you get it, you never want to go back. It is so comfortable that you almost forget that you have it in. It’s also a huge plus that this is so much more affordable and healthy than tampons. I recommend this to every girl I know who asks.
customer_reviews.author: brienna mcmanus

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I was super skeptical about menstrual cups. But since this one got great reviews and was a decent price I risked it and tried it. I LOVE IT! It’s so comfortable. I honestly forget that I have my period most of the time. Easy to care for. Comfortable to wear. Reusable. Money saver. What’s not to love!
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Olmstead

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. No more worrying about leaks or bleeding ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. No more worrying about leaks or bleeding through nice clothes, though I do like to pair it with THINX instead of using pads anyway. It's super easy to clean and carries no smell, and it feels like it's not even there. Finally, I don't have to interrupt my day to switch it out because it's is definitely safer than tampons. I recommend this product for all those wanting a simpler and more enjoyable experience with a totally natural bodily function.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great cup!
customer_reviews.text: So I found this cup on here after using a Diva cup for 3 years and trying a few other cups. For the price you cannot beat this. I have a heavy flow for 3 days out of my period so I always have to change my cups waaaaay more often then recommended but with this it seems like I have a longer buffer period before I have to worry about leaks. The stem is a bit pointy but I feel like after the first 5 minutes I dont notice it. The color hides stains too.
customer_reviews.author: M Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Not Medical Grade Silicon
customer_reviews.text: This cup appears like many other cups. I have a Diva, Xo, and a Lena. All three work well for me. I was getting this cup to replace my Diva as the price was good. It did not insert well. The sides are too flimsy. It naturally sits too close to the cervix and causes cramping. It caused the sides of my vaginal wall to burn. It does not have the same texture as my other cups--it is noticeably more grainy. I love my other menstrual cups. Do NOT buy this one. Spend more, get a better cup.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Definite learning curve
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Didn't leak. -Low chance of toxic shock. -You can wear it in preparation without any adverse side effects. Cons: -Uncomfortable if inserted incorrectly. -Super hard for me to break the suction and take out. I really want it to work for me, so I'm planning on trying it out again next time. All the reviews I've read have said how comfortable it is and convenient too! Hopefully I can get the hang of it soon!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Herbst

customer_reviews.title: Repeat User!!
customer_reviews.text: The silicone of this cup is much softer than ones I've used in the past. More comfortable and almost non-existent during use. It flexes and fold very easy but still keeps a good suction. Almost too good of a suction. It requires alittle extra work to set in place but, once in place, Perfect! I purchased the black cup and I'm beyond I'm love with it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Ortega

customer_reviews.title: IUD (paragaurd)
customer_reviews.text: I have an IUD (paragaurd) & the suction of the cup on my cervix was a little too much for me, it made me worry that taking out the cup would pull out my IUD, so i’ve stopped use & kept the cup in case of emergency if you have an IUD, be careful
customer_reviews.author: mariah

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought one sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I had been thinking about trying one of these for a while, and I wish I had bought one sooner! So much better than tampons. Went about 10 hours with absolutely no leaks, although I generally have a fairly light flow. I figured there'd be a learning curve, but it really only took a couple of times before I had it down. It's perfectly comfortable when inserted properly, and it's much better for the environment, so much less waste! Cheaper too! It'll be great for a day at the beach, or any all-day activity. Amazing product!
customer_reviews.author: chickilee

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know how I lived without this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one originally on a whim one night years after being frustrated about my allergy to traditional pads and tampons. Organic ones were only then available from online sources and weren’t exact efficient. I know how 3 of them and they allow me to swim, work, live, and sleep (most importantly sleep) without ANY worry of mess. They are soft silicone material. The lighter colors do stain a bit over time but it affect the function none. Also, the price point is amazing. The one I’ve had the longest is probably 3-4 years old at this point and works as good as new. Paid for itself in 3 months!!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Bennethum

customer_reviews.title: Athena Cup=Freedom and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this. It has literally changed my life. It only took two tries to figure out how to insert it properly, and it works perfectly. It is comfortable and easy to clean. It also irritates less than a tampon and allows me to be more comfortable and less crampy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Scott Laufenberg

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing product! I have very very heavy painful cycles and this product has made me feel a sense of normalcy again. It took a few trys to get the placement down, but wasn't difficult. A pad or tampon would last about an hour if I'm lucky. With this product I can make it until lunch on my heaviest day and a full work day other days. Why have I not been told about this before! In addition I feel cleaner and I'm happy about reducing the environmental waste. So worth a try!
customer_reviews.author: Buyher

customer_reviews.title: Very glad I made the switch!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first menstrual cup purchase. I was skeptical about the idea of the cup at first, but really wanted to find a more "natural" approach vs tampons. (As natural as silicone can get) I really like this product. I used it the first time with caution, expecting leakage but there was none, even when I didn't think I had inserted it correctly. This product comes with detailed instructions and it makes it difficult to go wrong. There is a nice carrying case to put the cup in so that it is discreet. I love this product and I am so glad I made the switch!
customer_reviews.author: tpeterson

customer_reviews.title: ... time I use a cup menstrual cup and I love, it is the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I use a cup menstrual cup and I love, it is the best, it is very soft, not hard to use at all. I to think I had a heavy flow, and I was thinking about buying the size 2, but i started reading about the reviews and i got the size 1, it works perfectly, I clean 3-4 times a day but I am sure i could do it 2 times and it would still be OK. This is the one you need!!!!! There is nothing better than not having to worry!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kausalya T

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite Amazon purchases
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first Athena Cup a about two years ago and will never go back to tampons or pads. I have heavy periods and haven't had a major leak yet. I also have had a lot of cramping in the past, but it's been notably better since using the Cup. There is a learning curve to proper putting it in and getting it out (similar to the first few uses of a tampon). The Athens Cup is way less expensive than the diva cup and certainly cheaper than buying a box of tampons every month. Also great for the environmental conscious.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Mack

customer_reviews.title: Worst Brand of Cup I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Leaks worse than any other brand of cup I've ever used. Might as well not even have it, because it's not catching anything. Wish I had not tried to save money by buying a less expensive brand. Throwing this in the trash and buying the one that costs twice as much, because it's more than twice as good.
customer_reviews.author: Kyt-10

customer_reviews.title: Great cup - but stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved this cup when I first got it, took a little bit of time to get used to and figure out how to insert properly to get it to suction on all the sides and also how to remove without any weird pain. And then it worked perfectly for about 6 cycles, but my last cycle and current one it just does not seem to work at all for the first few (heaviest) days of my period? I have no idea how or why! Constant leaks even though I am certain it is inserted correctly and suctioned well on the edges. So sad, I will have to try another brand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Your new buddy
customer_reviews.text: It actually worked incredibly well! I was super skeptical about it at first but it was so convenient and I never had problems with it staying put or not catching everything. The only problem I have with it, is sometimes it's challenging to grasp the end piece to pull it out. Make sure you have a strong thumb nail! You get used to it, however, so don't let that stop you from trying it. Oh, and no, you can't feel it while it's in. :) I'd buy it all over again knowing what I know now!
customer_reviews.author: Archangel7088

customer_reviews.title: Great product less waste
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure about using a cup but wanted to help with reducing waste so i tried this since it wasnt $60 like others ive seen. Its easy to use and works great. Ive used it for about half a year with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: rishima

customer_reviews.title: Softer than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Diva Cup for years. I figured I would be able to insert this one the same way. It is much too soft for the triangle fold (folding in one side to make a point). READ THE INSTRUCTIONS. Folding it over worked so much better. I did boil mine before the first use. I love the color (I chose green).
customer_reviews.author: FlippingPossum

customer_reviews.title: This Is The First Cup I've Tried
customer_reviews.text: I'm still getting the hang of it. It's okay, I got it inserted correctly the first try but for some reason it didn't seem to go in right after that. The stem doesn't bother me at all. There are several typos on the packaging and instruction booklet that are a tad annoying if that kind of thing bothers you. It makes the instructions a little less clear than they should be, but you can get the gist of it.
customer_reviews.author: TAE

customer_reviews.title: I love this cup
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a few cups in the past, but this one is great. It doesn’t stain, and it’s easy to get in and out. Only thing I’d change is the ridges on the stem; make an easier grip so I don’t have to shove my fingers up there when trying to remove it, but it’s fine. Overall, if this is your first or last cup I reccomend!!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I finally gave it a try!!
customer_reviews.text: This has changed my life one week of the month! I found it easy to use, comfortable and very effective. This is the first that I've tried after reading about all the different brands. This is definitely for light to medium flow. I had some trouble removing it but I contribute that to lack of experience. Tip: I found that squeezing my stomach muscles helped tremendously when removing. I'm ordering the size 2 for my heavier days. I'm 5' 1" and had twins naturally and have a tilted cervix.
customer_reviews.author: とも

customer_reviews.title: Great Cup
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty great menstrual cup. I usually use MeLuna cups, but I was interested in trying out other brands. The Athena is very easy to insert using a few different methods; sometimes it's difficult to get cups to pop back open once inserted, but I have not had that issue with the Athena. The cup in person is slightly more transparent than the photo here looks, but it's not like I'm going to spend a great deal of time gazing at it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellison Darling

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I hated wearing pads, and for the past 7 years I’ve had to wear special pads as regular pads have so much bleach and contaminants. I got a size 2, as I have endometriosis and fibroids also I’m used to having a heavier flow at times. However once it is suctioned in, you will not leak AT ALL. It was only the first couple days where the cup was 3/4 full. The other days it was 1/2 full or less. If you have a feminine issue and you need to track how much blood you lose, I’d highly recommend the cup. It’s stays put when you sleep, and it truly can be worn 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: D. Veronica

product_meta.title: Athena Menstrual Cups Period Cup - One Pack | Regular Flow | Transparent Clear Size 2 Large | A Softer Menstruation Cup Made for Easier Periods | Excellent Tampon and Pad Alternative
feature_bullets: EASY TO USE: Our innovative FORM-FIT Rim and softer silicone makes inserting and removing a breeze
FEEL THE FREEDOM: Leak Free and 12 hours between changes - The Ideal menstrual cup for beginners
WOMEN LOVE ATHENA: Over 250,000+ women use Athena for their periods and 9 out of 10 keep using it
LESS CRAMPS: Firm menstrual cups often cause painful cramping. Athena's Soft for a Pain Free Period
ATHENA SAFETY: Tested and Certified, Athena Cup is Phlalate Free, Latex Free, Dioxin Free, BPA Free
UNCONDITIONALLY GUARANTEED: Not fitting well? Dog ate your cup? We've got you covered - Hassle Free!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
